definition: to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time
article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: We should send these goods with defects back to the manufacturer.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該把這些殘次品退回廠家。

sentences.english: Four 12)raggedy excuses planted by the city.
sentences.chinese: 市政栽下充數的四棵殘次品。

sentences.english: There is a minimal quantity of imperfection in the batch.
sentences.chinese: 這批產品的殘次品極少。

sentences.english: Laser test rejected one copy out of 40.
sentences.chinese: 激光測試工序挑出了四十份拷貝中的一個殘次品。

sentences.english: Four raggedy excuses planted by the city.
sentences.chinese: 市政栽下充數的四棵殘次品。

sentences.english: There are many inferior porcelain vases in this batch whose causes we have to find out.
sentences.chinese: 陶瓷花瓶殘次品太多，我們一定要找出問題所在。

sentences.english: This jacket is actually a factory second, so it is quite inexpensive.
sentences.chinese: 夾克實際上是件殘次品，所以價格低廉。

sentences.english: The fewer the imperfections, the rarer and more valuable is the diamond.
sentences.chinese: 殘次品更少，貴重的物品更稀有和更多是鑽石。

sentences.english: This book is incomplete, and the secondary one with its second primary chronicle ripped off by someone.
sentences.chinese: 這本書是殘次品，本紀第二已經被人撕掉了。

definition: (jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
